page.title: 01Lleyn Penisular to NW Mynydd
page.content: Block is situated in centre of Peninsular 6 1/2 - 10 1/2 km from end at Trwyn Maenmelyn. The main Aberdaron road bisects it from Section 4 - 9 and is joined by the nefyn road from the north. The watershed is dominated by Purllech Hill (128m) and form faling away to the Such valley in the NE nd up to northern projection of Mynydd Rhiw in SE with Brynmawr Valley and village intervening.Westward is flat and undulating and almost treeless, to the north there is falling away of the land towards the coast. The area generally is bisected by small lanes. The houses vary from older one story cottages of ground stone to two storey buildings of quarried stone or brick, all with slate roof.
